summary: Phase 5A defined: logged-in users can submit Requests and Testimonies with media uploads, unique IDs, and instant Admin Dashboard visibility; testimonies media displays as interactive flippable cards with hover/click behaviors.
architectural_notes: Require authentication to submit Requests and Testimonies.
Persist unique identifiers for each submission (Request ID, Testimony ID) in backend.
Enforce testimony media constraints: up to 5 photos + 3 videos; max 800MB per file; videos <= 5 minutes; media description text <= 1,500 characters.
Admin Dashboard must receive new submissions instantly for review/moderation.
Testimonies UI uses interactive flippable media cards with hover preview and click-to-flip behavior (video hover plays; click flips and pauses; photos click flips to description).
known_issues: Automated build/implementation attempts for Phase 5/5A repeatedly failed; needs retry via smaller scoped steps or alternative implementation approach.

existing_features.title: Implement media attachment support for Requests (optional media) and Testimonies (up to 5 photos and 3 videos) using the existing backend blob storage mixin, storing media metadata alongside submissions.
Create customer-facing UI routes and forms for (1) submitting a Request and (2) submitting a Testimony, and ensure these forms are only accessible/usable when the user is logged in.

Expose the Request and Testimony submission entry points in the main navigation and on the Testimonies page (and add clear call-to-action links in relevant service/product areas without breaking existing flows).

Implement the Testimonies page to display testimony media as interactive flippable cards with hover and click effects: videos auto-preview on hover, click flips and pauses to show description; photos support hover zoom and click flips to show description.
Add admin dashboard UI to list newly submitted Requests and Testimonies, showing their unique IDs and key metadata, and refresh the lists immediately after a new submission succeeds.
Add React Query hooks in the existing query layer for creating and listing Requests/Testimonies (and any required admin actions), following existing actor-based patterns.

new_feature_requests.summary: Phase 5A submission system: logged-in users submit Requests and Testimonies; Requests include contact + description + optional media + price range/Flexible; Testimonies allow up to 5 photos and 3 videos with per-file limits and media descriptions; generate unique IDs; instant Admin Dashboard listing; testimonies media shown as flippable cards with hover/click interactions.
Add backend data models and APIs for customer Requests and Testimonies, each generating a unique ID on creation and persisting submissions so they can be listed in the admin dashboard.
Implement backend authorization rules so only logged-in users can submit Requests and Testimonies, and only admins can review/list submissions in the admin dashboard.

If the backend schema for testimonies/quote requests must change to support multiple media items and per-media descriptions, add a conditional migration that preserves existing stored data and increments IDs safely.

projectName: Phase 5A: Logged-in Requests & Testimonies submissions with media, unique IDs, flippable cards, and Admin listing
